page.title: 02LOTHIAN ESTATES
page.content: Lord Lothian owns 20,000 acres of land in the Borders. The main office is at Bondjedward where there are 12 employees.There are about 40 employees in the Forestry,Game,and Gardens departments. The main trees grown are Scots Pines,Sitka Spruce and Douglas Firs. The Woodland Centre located at Harestanes,opened in 1980,is to help people appreciate trees.It has an outdoor Play area,and an Audio-visual room.There are 5,000 visitors per year.Many do the walks around. Lord Lothian owns 9 farms in the area,and these are all tenanted. Lord Lothian lives at Monteviot House at holiday times.He often lives in London or at Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire.His son,Michael Ancrum,is Minister of Home Affairs for Scotland.
